street_food.name: Kachori Sabzi
street_food.description: Deep-fried bread stuffed with spiced lentils, served with potato curry
street_food.location: Vishwanath Gali, near Kashi Vishwanath Temple
street_food.cultural_insight: A traditional breakfast dish that locals have been enjoying for generations. Best eaten hot with tangy tamarind chutney.

street_food.name: Banarasi Paan
street_food.description: Betel leaf preparation with areca nut, lime, and various sweet or savory fillings
street_food.cultural_insight: An integral part of Banarasi culture, paan is consumed after meals as a digestive and mouth freshener. Each paan wallah has their own secret recipe.

street_food.name: Malaiyo
street_food.description: A winter delicacy made from milk foam, flavored with cardamom and garnished with pistachios
street_food.cultural_insight: Available only during winter months (December-February), this ethereal dessert is prepared in the early morning using dew and cold air.

street_food.name: Chaat
street_food.description: Tangy and spicy street snack with various combinations of potatoes, chickpeas, chutneys, and crispy elements
street_food.cultural_insight: Varanasi's chaat has a unique tangy flavor profile that differs from other cities, with generous use of local spices and tamarind.

street_food.name: Lassi
street_food.description: Thick yogurt-based drink served in traditional clay pots, available in sweet and salty varieties
street_food.cultural_insight: Served in kulhads (clay pots) that add an earthy flavor. The Blue Lassi Shop has been serving travelers since 1945.

shops.name: Mehrotra Silk Emporium
shops.description: Traditional Banarasi silk sarees and fabrics with intricate gold and silver thread work
shops.cultural_insight: Family-run business for over 100 years, specializing in authentic Banarasi silk weaving techniques passed down through generations.

shops.name: Vishwanath Book Store
shops.description: Ancient texts, spiritual books, and manuscripts related to Hindu philosophy and Varanasi's history
shops.cultural_insight: One of the oldest bookstores in Varanasi, housing rare manuscripts and texts on spirituality, philosophy, and local history.

shops.name: Brass Handicrafts Corner
shops.description: Traditional brass items including lamps, utensils, decorative pieces, and religious artifacts
shops.cultural_insight: Varanasi has been a center for brass work for centuries. These artisans use traditional techniques to create both functional and decorative items.

markets.name: Vishwanath Gali Market
markets.description: Narrow lanes filled with shops selling religious items, sweets, and traditional goods leading to Kashi Vishwanath Temple
markets.cultural_insight: This ancient market has been serving pilgrims for centuries. The narrow lanes are always bustling with devotees and vendors.

markets.name: Godowlia Market
markets.description: Main commercial hub with everything from clothes and electronics to street food and traditional items
markets.cultural_insight: The heart of Varanasi's commercial activity, where locals and tourists alike come for shopping and street food.

souvenirs.name: Miniature Brass Ganga Aarti Set
souvenirs.description: Small brass replica of the evening aarti ceremony items including lamps, bells, and incense holders
souvenirs.cultural_insight: Perfect memento of the famous Ganga Aarti ceremony. Each piece is handcrafted by local artisans.

souvenirs.name: Banarasi Silk Scarves
souvenirs.description: Lightweight silk scarves with traditional Banarasi patterns, perfect for gifts
souvenirs.cultural_insight: Made using the same techniques as traditional sarees but in a more accessible format for travelers.

clothing.name: Traditional Kurta Collection
clothing.description: Handwoven cotton and silk kurtas in traditional Banarasi styles for men and women
clothing.cultural_insight: These kurtas represent the traditional dress of Varanasi, often worn during festivals and religious ceremonies.

crafts.name: Wooden Toys and Figurines
crafts.description: Hand-carved wooden toys and religious figurines made by local artisans
crafts.cultural_insight: This craft has been practiced in Varanasi for generations, with each piece telling a story from Hindu mythology.

crafts.name: Stone Carving Workshop
crafts.description: Traditional stone carvings and sculptures, including miniature temple replicas
crafts.cultural_insight: Inspired by the ancient Buddhist and Hindu sculptures found in Sarnath and Varanasi temples.
